thread.title: Relive the wild ride that was the Oscars with the 10 most viral tweets
thread.title_full: Relive the wild ride that was the Oscars with the 10 most viral tweets

author: Johnny Lieu
title: Relive the wild ride that was the Oscars with the 10 most viral tweets
text:
If you're one of those people who think the Oscars is kinda boring, well, we certainly hope that Sunday night changed your mind.
There was a gluttony of incredible, if often cringeworthy moments: From that Hollywood tour randomly paying a visit, to that wild ending in which Moonlight was (eventually) crowned Best Picture.
SEE ALSO: In-N-Out, photo booths, and more: Celebs rage after craziest Oscars yet
There were plenty of moments the internet couldn't help but pick out. But don't worry, we've compiled Twitter's top 10 most retweeted tweets from the Oscars. Please enjoy.
This red carpet observation scored plenty of retweets. So many Asian ppl at the oscars tonight so exciting pic.twitter.com/5A4nh2Zou4
‚Äî Preeti Chhibber (@runwithskizzers) February 27, 2017
As did this classic throwback. lets remember this iconic devil wears prada moment at the oscars 2007 pic.twitter.com/r5GNU8lclC
‚Äî gabe tarantino ‚ú∞ (@mrylstrp) February 26, 2017
And who could forget this 2015 tweet from Trump? The Oscars are a sad joke, very much like our President. So many things are wrong!
‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 23, 2015
Then there's this simple message. That comes from the heart. John Legend performing at the Oscars (2017) pic.twitter.com/YEbdMq094O
‚Äî memes (@memeprovider) February 27, 2017
TFW of being amongst the *excitement* of a tour group that's crashed the Oscars. Sharing the love #Oscars pic.twitter.com/yCE64U98Cp
‚Äî Keith Urban (@KeithUrban) February 27, 2017
Or noticing how many Oscars Leonardo DiCaprio missed out on. leonardo dicaprio, and the ghosts of all the oscars he never won pic.twitter.com/0Nf6rVpIdr
‚Äî keely flaherty (@flahertykeely) February 27, 2017
Of course, there's the disastrous Best Picture announcement. BREAKING UPDATE: Following incorrect announcement, 'Moonlight' has won 'Best Picture' at the #Oscars . https://t.co/esmdczoPpT pic.twitter.com/9KWTsLlzrH
‚Äî ABC News (@ABC) February 27, 2017
And realising how much of a f*ck up it was. well at least for the rest of my life when i make a mistake i'll think "at least i didn't fuck up as hard as the 2017 oscars envelope guy"
‚Äî Dan Howell (@danisnotonfire) February 27, 2017
But it didn't take away from what an achievement it was for 'Moonlight.' A black film won best picture and no slavery or maids were involved in the making of the film. #Oscars pic.twitter.com/VtziiGZS1q
‚Äî Kevin Simmons (@TheSkorpion) February 27, 2017
Moonlight is the 1st Best Picture #Oscars winner with an ALL-Black cast pic.twitter.com/PuZ6Qfemk3
‚Äî Wilson Morales (@blackfilm) February 27, 2017
Oh, and one more thing, here's Jackie Chan talking about pandas! JACKIE CHAN IS SO PROUD TO BE AN AMBASSADOR OF PANDAS! PROTECT HIM AT ALL COSTS #Oscars üò©üêº pic.twitter.com/3bBhKBjsQY
‚Äî ü•Ä (@abbygriffiin) February 26, 2017
BONUS: Viola Davis is the first black woman to win an Emmy, Tony, and now, an Oscar for acting
